main event: A round, silver object the size of a pen head was seen for approximately 15 minutes over Van Nuys, California on March 15, 1956.
interesting points: The object was stationary and disappeared in a rapid and ominous manner.
The sighting was reported by a civilian observer.
The object was observed directly overhead from a Ground Observer Corps (GOC) post.
No interception of the object was made, and no subsequent reports of the object were received.
The sighting was investigated by KEYSTONE DOG, which involved Captain Shairman and Lt. J.G. Ainey.
sighted object: a round, silver object the size of a pen head
